result.execSummary:
The defendant Matthew Mark Edward Short was found guilty of the following charge(s) in this case.

  • Burglary-Building or Dwelling [Modifiers: PTAC, as a Party to a Crime, Repeater], a class F felony, Wisconsin Statutes 943.10(1m)(a).
  • Bail Jumping-Misdemeanor [Modifiers: Repeater], a class A misdemeanor, Wisconsin Statutes 946.49(1)(a).

Charge(s) in this case were read in to this or other case(s). A "read in" charge is a charge that is dismissed as part of a plea agreement, however:

  • The defendant agrees to have the court consider the charge(s) when sentencing for another crime, under Wis. Stats. 973.20(1g)(b); and
  • The defendant cannot be prosecuted for these charge(s) in the future.

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.

records.addlTxt:
AND ARRAIGNMENT 9:48 AM Defendant Matthew Mark Edward Short in court, in custody.  Attorney Chris A Gramstrup in court for Matthew Mark Edward Short.  Attorney Chad C La Lor in court for State of Wisconsin. Attorney Gramstrup received information. Attorney Gramstrup recites agreement that in 20CM239, defendant to plead to Count 1. Count 2 to be dismissed but read in. For 22CF152, defendant to plead to counts 2, and 3. Remaining counts of 1 and 4 are dismissed but read in. For Count 1 in 20CM239, 9 days jail with credit for 9 days, time served. Consecutive to 22CF152 and pay a $50 fine plus costs. In 22CF152, for Count 2, withheld sentence for 3 years probation. Conditions of probation include serve 29 days jail with credit for 29 days, comply with all programming as deemed necessary and pay a $100 fine plus costs. For Count 3, serve 38 days with credit for 29 days concurrent to Count 2 but consecutive to 20CM239. Defendant pleads no contest to each count. Attorney Gramstrup stipulates to a factual basis. Court accepts the Defendant's plea and finds that the Defendant's plea has been freely, voluntarily and intelligently made. The Defendant understands all the rights he is waiving by his plea. The Defendant is found guilty and Judgment of Conviction is entered.

Court imposes for Count 1 in 20CM239, 9 days jail with credit for 9 days, time served. Consecutive to 22CF152 and pay a $50 fine plus costs. In 22CF152, for Count 2, withheld sentence for 3 years probation. Conditions of probation include serve 29 days jail with credit for 29 days, comply with all programming as deemed necessary and pay a $100 fine plus costs. For Count 3, serve 38 days with credit for 29 days - time served, concurrent to Count 2.

9:43 AM Defendant Matthew Mark Edward Short in court, in custody.  Attorney Chris A Gramstrup in court for Matthew Mark Edward Short.  Attorney Mark Fruehauf in court for State of Wisconsin. Court calls cases 20CM239 and 22CF152. Attorney Gramstrup reviews that the defendant missed court but was in inpatient treatment at that time. A warrant was issued and bail was ordered at $5,000 and $1,000. Defendant is unable to post. Asks that defendant be released on a high signature bond to allow defendant to going to treatment. Defendant states he was in treatment at the time of the missed hearing. State opposes the reduction. Notes that previous signature bonds have not assured the defendant's appearances in court. State reviews defendant's FTAs in Douglas County files. State notes that he is alleged to have committed more crimes while out on bail. State notes notes the defendant has at least 22 prior criminal convictions. State recites criminal history and reviews FTAs in MN cases. Court reviews previous signature bond and FTAs in 20CM239. Court notes that 22CF152 was alleged to have occurred while defendant was out on bail in 20CM239. Court notes concerns over defendant's prior criminal history and nature of the offenses.

Court denies the request for bail modification.
State's Demand for Discovery and Inspection
Letter from Defendant to Judge Glonek regarding release
Defendant's Demand for Discovery and Inspection

records.addlTxt:
8:15 AM Defendant Matthew Mark Edward Short in court, in custody.  Attorney Chris A Gramstrup in court for Matthew Mark Edward Short.  Attorney Chad C La Lor in court for State of Wisconsin. 
Attorney-Client waives preliminary hearing. Court finds waiver knowing/voluntary; finds probable cause that a felony was committed and binds over for arraignment. Court reminds of bail/conditions. 20CM239 set for STC
Amended Notice of Motion to Modify Bail
Bail/bond hearing on August 2, 2022 at 09:45 am.

ADDRESS INFO for Matthew Mark Edward Short
Current: 2211 Graceland Rd, Duluth, MN 55812 United States  (Effective: 07-14-2022)
Prior: 632 Grand Ave, Superior, WI 54880
No contact with victim 1 or residence, no contact with witness 1

1:47 PM Prosecuting attorney Chad C La Lor in court for the State of Wisconsin.  Defendant Matthew Mark Edward Short appeared by video, in custody.  Attorney Chris A Gramstrup in court for Matthew Mark Edward Short. 
Defendant received complaint
Court quashes warrants
Att Gramstrup- received complaint NG pleas on cts 3 and 4, requests prelim on felonies
Court notes judge orders $5000 cash on 20CM239
Defendant- Was in treatment at time of pretrial, was unable to appear 
Att Gramstrup- tried to verify treatment but was unable due to privacy issues. they were trying to do Zoom, doesn't believe arrangements were made with Court first
Defendant makes statement
State requests $5000 cash in 20CM239 same conditions. On 22CF152 $3500 cash, no contact with victim 1 or address and no contact with witness 1. Notes lengthy criminal history, FTA's in WI and MN
Att Gramstrup- Notes $5000 will keep him incarcerated if ordered in 20CM239, any more in CF file wouldn't make a difference
Defendant makes statement- tried to call on court date
Court- Has to order $5000 due to judge's orders on 20CM239 No contact with victim 1 or residence, no drugs or paraph.. On 22CF152 $1000 cash, no contact with victim 1 or residence, no contact with witness 1
Adjourned plea hearing scheduled for July 20, 2022 at 08:15 am.
Signed Cash bond; 2020CM000239; Short, Matthew Mark Edward
